      • DatabaseService

        public DatabaseService(java.lang.String databasePath)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Construct an easy-to-use representation of the database specified by the file.
        Parameters:
        databasePath - The path of the database file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the database file does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the database file does not have the specified tables

      • userExists

        public boolean userExists(java.lang.String email)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method looks in the database if the user specified by it's e-mail exists.
        Parameters:
        email - The e-mail of the user. (it is the attribute that represent an user!)
        Returns:
        True if the user exists in the library, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If string email is null

      • fetchUserProperties

        public java.util.Map<User.Property,java.lang.String> fetchUserProperties(java.lang.String email)
                                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method fetches all the property of the user specified by it's email
        Parameters:
        email - The e-mail of the user. (it is the attribute that represent an user!)
        Returns:
        A map of all properties for the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the user does not exist see userExists

        This method creates a GameTree for the player in the database
        Parameters:
        email - The unique identifier of the player
        rootID - The unique ID of the root (has only to be unique across nodes of the user)
